inclusion.criterion: Clinical diagnosis of episodic migraine according to ICHD-II criteria at least 2 months prior to enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to undertake designated level of Tai Chi exercise
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Live in Hong Kong, can read and speak Cantonese or Putonghua
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Severe migraine attacks with disabilities that cannot perform moderate intensity physical activity
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Secondary headache and other neurological disease
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: More than 5 days of non-migrainous headache per month
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Experience with Tai Chi practice after diagnosis of migraine
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Regular performance of Tai Chi or other body-mind exercises (yoga, biofeedback, medication, etc.)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Undergoing other alternative therapeutic treatments during recruitment period, or received other alternative therapeutic treatments in the past 12 weeks
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy, lactation period, or currently using contraceptives
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Use of pharmacological prophylactic treatment for migraine in the past 12 weeks
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 15 year old girl with recurrent bilateral headache. She has been diagnosed with migraine and is under treatment.
